document.discussion_title: Asian Rubber Futures End Higher Led by Shanghai Futures
document.topic_text: By Lucy Craymer Tokyo rubber future prices ended higher, lifted by strength in Shanghai rubber futures. "A rise in the Shanghai market has lifted the mood of the market as investors indulged in active trading," said Kaname Gokon, an analyst at Okato Shoji. Signs from China's consumer, investment and factory sectors indicate that the slowdown in the world's second-biggest economy may be bottoming out and heading for an upward trend, he added. Benchmark Tocom rubber contracts for October delivery finished at 201.0 yen per kilogram Monday. Asian Rubber Futures April 25 Change from previous close Tocom Sep RSS3 Y199.4/Kg Up Y0.8/Kg Shanghai Sep SCR5 CNY13,095/Ton Up CNY55/Ton Thai Sep RSS3 THB62.20/Kg Down THB0.86/Kg Sicom Sep RSS3 US 175.8 cents/Kg Down US 0.7 cents/Kg Sicom Sep TSR20 US 159.2 cents/Kg Up US 2.9 cents/Kg Asian Physical Rubber Grade Shipment Apr 25 Apr 22 RSS3 May/Jun 180-181 179-178 STR20 May/Jun 162-163 160-161 SIR20 May/Jun 161-162 158-159 SMR20 May/Jun 160-161 158-159 SVR3L May/Jun 170-171 163-164 USS April THB57.27-THB58.70/Kg THB58.39-THB58.85/Kg Write to Lucy Craymer at lucy.craymer@wsj.com, @lucy_craymer 06:58 ET (10:58
